description: Ethernet Cables connect computers to the internet
name: Ethernet Cables

description: Calculators compute numbers. They come in small to medium sizes and run on batteries or connect to electricity via cables.
name: Calculator

description: Portable speakers allow you to broadcast music and sounds anywhere within bluetooth range of a computer or phone.
name: Portable speakers

description: Keyboards input numbers, letters, and characters into laptops, tablets, phones, and other devices.
name: Keyboard

description: Thermometers check the temperature of animals, humans, and food.
name: Thermometer

description: Earphones play sound directly to an individual's ears when connected to a device that plays music.
name: Earphones

description: Apple Macintosh SE was one of the earliest portable personal computers.
name: Apple Macintosh SE

description: Batteries of various kinds provide stored energy in almost every electronic device.
name: Batteries

description: Car Batteries store energy from driving motion and/or from plugging into a power station.
name: Car Battery

description: Tesla Powerwall batteries store backup electical power from solar panels.
name: Tesla Battery

description: Digital Cameras use sensors and software to capture wavelengths of light, which is saved to a card or drive for later use.
name: Digital Camera

description: Surveillance Cameras are connected to monitors, tapes, and/or drives to capture images 24 hours per day.
name: Surveillance Camera

description: Capacitors store electric charges in digital devices.
name: Capacitor

description: Compact Discs (CDs) store digital files such as music, movies, documents, and photos.
name: Stack of CDs

description: Cellular telephones connect with other telephones via a wide area radio system without a physical, wired connection.
name: Flip Phone Cellphone

description: Lilypad is a circuit board that can be sewn into textiles using conductive thread.
name: Lilypad Circuit Board

description: A printed Circuit Board (PCB) mechanically supports and electrically connects capacitors and resistors together so they can receive instructions from software.
name: Circuit Board

description: Fiber Optic Cables transmit light-beams of data via tiny glass or plastic filaments.
name: Fiber Optic Cables

description: High-Definition Multimedia Interface (HDMI) cables transfer audio and video data from computers to monitors or similar devices.
name: HDMI Cable

description: Tablet computers are light-weight touch-screen-enabled handheld computers with rechargeable batteries for easy mobility.
name: Apple iPad

description: Laptop computers are light-weight keyboard- and sometimes touch-screen-enabled computers with rechargeable batteries that sit on a lap or table for easy writing and viewing.
name: Laptop

description: Electronic toys typically include button and/or voice input and audio output with interactive education and entertainment software.
name: Electronic Toys

description: Smart thermostats learn from your habits and can be controlled via a phone app.
name: Smart Thermostat

description: Smart Watches are mini computers for the hand. They sync up with other devices to deliver message, calls, and data.
name: Smart Watch

description: Laser Printers convert electronic data from a computer to electrostatically charged dots which attract dry ink powder (known as toner) which is then transfered to paper and heated.
name: Laser Printer

description: Inkjet Printers convert electronic data from a computer to dots of wet ink sprayed onto paper.
name: Inkjet Printer

description: Boom Boxes output audio and music recordings from compact discs (CDs) and/or cassette tapes.
name: Boom Box CD and Cassette Player

description: Transistor Radios are portable, transistor-based radio receivers that play sound via radio waves.
name: Transistor Radio

description: Robotic Arms are programmable rotary and linear joints which can be manipulated by software to perform repetitive tasks with extreme accuracy.
name: Robotic Arm

description: Robotic Hands are programmable rotary and linear joints which can be manipulated by software to perform near-human tasks such as sensing, grasping, poking, and carrying.
name: Robotic Hand

description: Robotic Quadrupeds are programmable rotary and linear joints which can be manipulated by software to perform high-speed transportation.
name: Robotic Quadruped

description: Solar cells use photovoltaics to convert sunlight directly into electricity. Cells are typically made of semiconductors and silicon.
name: Solar Panel

description: Digital Telephones convert sound into digital data to be transmitted via copper wire, cellular, or satellite radio waves.
name: Digital Telephone

description: Analog Televisions display brightness, colors, and sound by rapid variations of either the amplitude, frequency or phase of the signal being broadcast from a television station.
name: Analog Television

description: High-Definition Televisions (HDTV) display high-resolution digital sound and video from broadcasted or internet services.
name: High Definition Telvision

description: Electric Typewriters allow humans to write by typing characters on a mechanical keyboard which imprints a set of inked metal characters on a piece of paper.
name: Electric Typewriter

description: USB thumb drives are external rewritable and removable Flash memory storage sticks which are smaller than optical storage discs found inside computers.
name: USB Thumb Drive
